thoughts.summary: Explaining company conversion and setup in Singapore
thoughts.content: To convert a sole proprietorship to a Private Limited Company in Singapore, you can't simply "convert" — you incorporate a new entity and transfer business assets/contracts. Include essential tasks like registering with ACRA, reserving your company name, appointing directors, setting up compliance for taxes and employees, and understanding PDPA for data protection.
chunks: To convert a sole proprietorship to a Private Limited Company in Singapore, you can't simply "convert" — you incorporate a new entity and transfer business assets/contracts. Include essential tasks like registering with ACRA, reserving your company name, appointing directors, setting up compliance for taxes and employees, and understanding PDPA for data protection.

thoughts.summary: Company secretary, compliance, and financial duties
thoughts.content: In Singapore, a company must appoint a secretary within six months, and they cannot be the sole director. Auditors are required unless exempt. Companies must maintain registers, file annual returns, and adhere to financial statement standards (SFRS). Tax filings, CPF for employees, and GST registration may also apply, especially if turnover surpasses 1 million. Remuneration and compliance depend on company structure.

thoughts.summary: Setting up a corporate bank account and registration
thoughts.content: To set up a corporate account in Singapore, you’ll need a business profile, constitution, board resolution, identification, and details about the ultimate beneficial owner (UBO). Documentation varies by bank, such as DBS, OCBC, UOB, and digital banks like Wise. Foreign-owned companies may also face certain restrictions. Additionally, tuition centres must register with the Ministry of Education (MOE) under the Private Education Act.

thoughts.summary: Company registration and timeline in Singapore
thoughts.content: If you had previously registered your tuition centre as a sole proprietorship, you'll need to update your licenses with the CPE. As for a general company setup timeline: Pre-incorporation (0-1 week) includes deciding structure, preparing documents. Post-incorporation includes tasks like registering with IRAS, appointing a company secretary, and transferring assets like leases and contracts. Don't forget to close your sole prop and inform customers. Remember, this isn't legal advice—consult a professional.

thoughts.summary: Accounting and Company Compliance in Singapore
thoughts.content: For accounting, you'll need to pick a fiscal year end, keep proper records, and adopt accounting standards. Consider hiring an accountant or using software, and track receipts. Appoint a company secretary within 6 months. Small companies may be exempt from audits. Ensure registers and returns are filed timely. Your office should be open 3 hours daily, and bank account setup requires KYC. If you hire employees, CPF contributions are necessary. Also, local director requirements may apply based on employment pass status.

Also, look into tax exemptions or partial deductions for the new company, such as start-up tax exemption.

thoughts.summary: Step-by-step company transition plan
thoughts.content:
1. Decide whether to continue both entities or cease operations. Choose a new company name, establish shareholding, directorship, paid-up capital, registered office, and financial year end (FYE).  
2. Incorporate via ACRA BizFile.  
3. Compliance: appoint secretary, auditor, set up registers, open bank account, and more.  
4. Business transfer: assets, leases, contracts, etc.  
5. Close sole proprietorship: file cessation, deregister GST, final tax.

thoughts.summary: Identifying relevant agencies for business setup and compliance
thoughts.content:
To start, there are key agencies:  
- ACRA for company incorporation, cessation, and returns.  
- IRAS handles corporate tax and GST.  
- Corppass for government digital services.  
- CPF Board for employee-related obligations.  
- MOM for work passes, if applicable.  
- PDPC for data protection, if necessary.  
- GoBusiness Licensing and banking authorities like MAS.

thoughts.summary: Key points for incorporating a business and compliance
thoughts.content: When incorporating, it’s good to consider signing a resolution for a bank account (many banks offer templates). Remember, you don't need the account open before incorporation — just the UEN. Paid-up capital can be as low as S$1, though a bank may inquire. ACRA requires an accessible registered office for at least 3 hours during business days. If using a home address, a corporate service provider may be needed. Store the signed constitution at the registered office as well. Annual return needs to be filed within 7 months of FYE, and AGMs may not be necessary for private companies if financial statements are sent to members within 5 months.

thoughts.summary: Incorporation process and compliance
thoughts.content: When exempt from holding an AGM, remember to file an annual return within 7 months after the FYE and send financial statements within 5 months. For incorporating, a corporate service provider (CSP) might be needed for director or secretary roles. If you’re the only shareholder-director, a separate secretary is required. After incorporation, create board resolutions for opening a bank account and appointing signatories. Finally, don't forget to handle corporate governance, including minutes, resolutions, and share certificates.
chunks: When exempt from holding an AGM, remember to file an annual return within 7 months after the FYE and send financial statements within 5 months.
For incorporating, a corporate service provider (CSP) might be needed for director or secretary roles.
If you’re the only shareholder-director, a separate secretary is required.
After incorporation, create board resolutions for opening a bank account and appointing signatories.
Finally, don't forget to handle corporate governance, including minutes, resolutions, and share certificates.

thoughts.summary: Incorporation timeline and tasks
thoughts.content:
I'll lay out a clear timeline and key tasks with deadlines to keep things easy to follow:

1. **Pre-incorporation (Days 0-7)** – Decisions & Preparation  
2. **Incorporation (Day 1-3)** – ACRA BizFile  
3. **Post-incorporation (Week 1-4)** – Bank Account, Corppass, IRAS, Registers  
4. **Within 3 months** – Auditor (if needed)  
5. **Within 5-7 months after FYE** – Send FS, AGM, Annual Return  
6. **Within 3 months after FYE** – ECI Filing

thoughts.summary: Corporate Tax Return Deadline
thoughts.content:
Each year, by **30 November**, you need to file the corporate tax return. This is a key deadline to remember for compliance. 

**Sole Proprietorship Transfer**

For transferring from a sole proprietorship to a company, consider the effective transfer date. You’ll need to file final sole proprietorship tax returns and possibly inform IRAS about cessation, although ACRA handles it.

**Corporate Bank Account & Stationery**

When setting up a corporate bank account, some banks may require an initial deposit—but it's not always necessary. 

Also, make sure to update your corporate stationery with the new UEN and company name.

**Data & Employment Contracts**

If you have employees, updating contracts is necessary. However, as you've mentioned no employees, this won't apply to you for now. 

Let's plan the response with clear headings.

metadata.reasoning_title: Providing company setup procedure, timeline, and compliance steps

parts:
In Singapore you generally **don’t “convert”** a sole proprietorship into a private limited company (“Pte Ltd”) in-place. You **incorporate a new company** and then **transfer/novate** the business (contracts, lease, assets, customers) to the company, and finally **cease** the sole proprietorship if you want. citeturn1search2

## Who you’ll liaise with
- **Accounting and Corporate Regulatory Authority (ACRA)**: incorporate the Pte Ltd, registered office, officers, annual return, statutory registers (controllers/nominees), cessation of sole prop. citeturn4view0turn5view0turn3view0turn3view1turn1search2  
- **Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore (IRAS)**: corporate income tax filing (Estimated Chargeable Income (ECI), Form C-S / Form C-S (Lite) / Form C), Goods and Services Tax (GST) if applicable. citeturn0search2turn2search10turn1search0  
- **Corppass (corporate digital authorisation)**: to let you/your accountant access government e-services (notably IRAS). citeturn6search4turn6search16  
- **Your bank** (DBS/OCBC/UOB/etc.): corporate bank account opening (KYC/AML checks, document submission). citeturn13search8turn13search1turn13search6  
- **Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board**: if you hire staff **or** pay yourself wages as an employee/director under a contract of service (CPF contributions may apply). citeturn6search7turn6search15  
- **Ministry of Manpower (MOM)**: only if you use work-pass holders as directors/for employment matters (e.g., Employment Pass holder directorship needs Letter of Consent). citeturn6search1turn4view0  
- **Sector/licensing authorities (case-by-case)**: if your business has licences tied to your sole prop’s UEN, you’ll typically need to update/re-apply under the company UEN (use GoBusiness Licensing as the starting point).

---

## Step-by-step procedure + practical timeline

### Phase 0 — Pre-incorporation planning (Day 0–3)
1. **Decide your company structure**
   - Shareholders, paid-up capital, business activities (SSIC), who will be **director(s)**, who will be **company secretary**, who will be bank signatories.
   - You must have **at least 1 director who is a local resident in Singapore**. citeturn4view0  
2. **Pick a Financial Year End (FYE)** (e.g., 31 Dec / 31 Mar / 30 Jun / 30 Sep). This drives your filing calendar. citeturn12search19turn11search0  
3. **Prepare your constitution**
   - You submit a constitution at incorporation; keep the signed copy at the registered office. citeturn6search14turn2search0  
4. **Registered office arrangement**
   - Must be accessible to the public **≥ 3 hours each business day** (it can be a CSP address). citeturn2search1turn2search5  

### Phase 1 — Incorporate the Pte Ltd with ACRA (Day 1–7)
5. **Name application + incorporation via BizFile (ACRA)**
   - Incorporate online (Singpass). ACRA’s BizFile incorporation guide lays out the flow. citeturn2search12turn2search4  
6. **Officers**
   - You’ll appoint director(s) during incorporation.
   - **Company secretary must be appointed within 6 months**; the **sole director cannot also be the company secretary**. citeturn4view0  
   - If you are **not audit-exempt**, appoint an **auditor within 3 months** of incorporation. citeturn4view0  

### Phase 2 — Immediately after incorporation (Week 1–4)
7. **Set up statutory registers & controller/nominee filings (ACRA)**
   - **Register of Registrable Controllers (RORC)**: since 16 Jun 2025, **new entities lodge controller info with ACRA on the date of incorporation**, and later updates must be lodged **within 2 business days**. citeturn3view0  
   - **Nominee director/shareholder registers**: if you have any nominee arrangements, information must be filed to ACRA’s central registers; updates also within **2 business days**. citeturn3view1  
8. **Set up Corppass**
   - Create Corppass admin and grant access for IRAS (and CPF, if needed). citeturn6search4turn6search16  
9. **Open the company bank account**
   - See detailed checklist below (docs + bank quirks).  
10. **Accounting system & bookkeeping**
   - Start proper bookkeeping from Day 1: sales/receipts, expenses, bank reconciliation, director/shareholder transactions.
   - Even if you’re exempt from filing financial statements with ACRA (see below), you still need proper accounts for IRAS and practical governance. citeturn9view0turn8search2  
11. **IRAS + GST decision**
   - Corporate income tax: plan for **ECI within 3 months after FYE** and annual corporate return **by 30 Nov**. citeturn0search2turn2search10turn2search18  
   - **GST**: register if you reasonably expect taxable turnover **> S$1m in the next 12 months** (apply within 30 days after that forecast). citeturn1search0  

### Phase 3 — Transfer the business from sole prop to company (Week 2–8)
12. **Transfer/novation checklist (most commonly forgotten)**
   - Premises lease (often needs landlord consent/novation)
   - Vendor contracts (internet, payment gateway, software, insurance)
   - Customer contracts/terms & conditions (update contracting entity, invoices/receipts)
   - Intellectual property (brand, domain name, materials), social media pages
   - Any licences/approvals registered under the sole prop UEN (update/re-apply)
13. **Operational switch-over date**
   - From that date: all revenue/expenses run through the Pte Ltd (and bank account), new invoices show Pte Ltd name + UEN.

### Phase 4 — Close the sole proprietorship (optional but common) (Week 4–10)
14. **Cease the sole proprietorship via BizFile**
   - Use the BizFile “File cessation or dissolution…” eService. citeturn1search2turn1search6  
   - If the sole prop was GST-registered, also cancel GST registration with IRAS. citeturn1search2  

---

## Company bank account setup (what banks usually require)
Typical documents (varies by bank; expect additional KYC questions):
- **ACRA Business Profile** / company details
- **Certificate of Incorporation**
- **Constitution** (certified true copy often requested)
- **Board resolution / account opening resolution** naming authorised signatories
- **IDs + proof of address** for directors/signatories/ultimate beneficial owners (KYC)
- Tax declarations such as **Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (FATCA)** / **Common Reporting Standard (CRS)** forms (bank-provided)

Examples from banks’ own checklists:
- UOB (private limited): ACRA Business Profile Search, account opening resolution, certified true copy of constitution, plus KYC/tax forms. citeturn13search6  
- OCBC: requires certified true copy of constitution and certified true copies of address proof for relevant persons (per their checklist PDF). citeturn13search1  
- DBS: account-opening checklist includes board resolution and supporting documents; DBS also provides sample board resolution templates. citeturn13search8turn13search0  

Practical gotcha: **some banks require in-person attendance and may ask for 2 directors/signatories** depending on their process (so if you’re a one-director company, pick the bank/product accordingly or be ready to add an additional authorised signatory/director). citeturn13search15  

---

## Ongoing compliance calendar (what will keep you out of trouble)

### ACRA (corporate compliance)
- **Company secretary**: appoint within **6 months**, must be locally resident; sole director cannot be secretary. citeturn4view0  
- **Registered office**: open/access **≥ 3 hours** each business day. citeturn2search1turn2search5  
- **Controllers (RORC)**: lodge on incorporation; updates within **2 business days** of updating your private register. citeturn3view0  
- **Nominee registers**: if applicable, central register filings; updates within **2 business days**. citeturn3view1  
- **AGM / sending financial statements**:
  - Non-listed companies: AGM within **6 months** after FYE, annual return within **7 months** after FYE. citeturn12search2turn5view0  
  - Private companies can be **exempted from holding AGMs** if they send financial statements to members within **5 months** after FYE (subject to safeguards). citeturn12search3  
- **Annual return (AR)**: private companies file within **7 months** after FYE. citeturn5view0  
- **Financial statements filing with ACRA (XBRL)**:
  - In general, companies file financial statements unless exempt; **solvent exempt private companies (EPCs)** are **not required to file** financial statements (filing is voluntary). citeturn9view0  
  - Regardless, most companies still must **prepare** financial statements (except certain dormant cases). citeturn9view0  

### Audit (if applicable)
- Audit is required **unless** you qualify for audit exemption (commonly the “small company” concept). Criteria include meeting at least 2 of: revenue ≤ S$10m, assets ≤ S$10m, employees ≤ 50 (assessed over the required periods). citeturn0search7turn0search3  
- If not exempt, appoint auditor within **3 months** of incorporation. citeturn4view0  

### IRAS (tax)
- **ECI (Estimated Chargeable Income)**: file within **3 months after FYE** (waiver possible if revenue ≤ S$5m and ECI is NIL). citeturn0search2turn8search6turn8search10  
- **Corporate income tax return** (Form C-S / Form C-S (Lite) / Form C): file by **30 Nov** each year. citeturn2search10turn2search18  
- **GST**: compulsory registration if you expect taxable turnover **> S$1m** in next 12 months; apply within 30 days. citeturn1search0  

### CPF (if you pay wages / hire)
- Employers must pay CPF contributions for Singapore Citizen/PR employees earning > $50/month. citeturn6search7  
- Directors: CPF is payable on wages if the director is engaged under a **contract of service** (employment). citeturn6search15  

---

## Official starting points (Singapore)
```text
ACRA – Setting up a local company:
https://www.acra.gov.sg/how-to-guides/setting-up-a-local-company

ACRA – Appointing directors / company secretary / auditor timelines:
https://www.acra.gov.sg/how-to-guides/setting-up-a-local-company/appointing-directors-company-secretary-and-other-key-personnel

ACRA – Annual obligations (AGM / Annual Return):
https://www.acra.gov.sg/how-to-guides/setting-up-a-local-company/what-you-have-to-file-each-year
https://www.acra.gov.sg/how-to-guides/annual-general-meetings/timeline-for-holding-agms
https://www.acra.gov.sg/how-to-guides/annual-general-meetings/exemptions-from-holding-an-agm

ACRA – Controllers / nominees:
https://www.acra.gov.sg/compliance/register-of-registrable-controllers
https://www.acra.gov.sg/compliance/registers-of-nominee-directors-and-nominee-shareholders

ACRA – Closing sole proprietorship:
https://www.acra.gov.sg/how-to-guides/closing-a-sole-proprietorship-or-partnership

IRAS – ECI:
https://www.iras.gov.sg/taxes/corporate-income-tax/estimated-chargeable-income-(eci)-filing

IRAS – Corporate tax filing basics:
https://www.iras.gov.sg/taxes/corporate-income-tax/basics-of-corporate-income-tax/basic-guide-to-corporate-income-tax-for-companies

IRAS – GST registration threshold:
https://www.iras.gov.sg/taxes/goods-services-tax-(gst)/gst-registration-deregistration/do-i-need-to-register-for-gst

Corppass portal:
https://www.corppass.gov.sg/portal
```

If you tell me (1) whether you’ll be the **only director/shareholder**, (2) whether you want to **keep the same business name**, and (3) whether you expect turnover anywhere near **S$1m**, I can turn the above into a tighter “do-this-next” checklist with dates anchored to your intended incorporation date and FYE.
